summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and bromoform are both classified as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and are mentioned as common soil pollutants. They are part of two groups categorized by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) based on their potential carcinogenicity. While both compounds are linked through their environmental impact and classification, the context does not provide specific interactions or direct relationships between them beyond their shared status as pollutants.
